page.title: 01Arable Lands of the Marches
page.content: The block is made up of predominantly farming land. Gentle undulating landscape with hedged boundaries. Wooded hills rising to the east. Farms of mixed size 50-300 acres. Sheep, cattle and arable farms with a few old orchards. A49 road runs north to south as does railway line Crew-Cardiff and the B4361. Dotted along these 2 roads lie most of the houses. In the centre of block is a wireless transmitter station with many masts which can be seen from nearly all parts of the block. 4 villages are ontained in the block, the largest orleton has main drainage and has enlarged recently. The other villages are small and spread oiut.
